name: Kabuli
history: Kabuli is a rice-based dish popular in North India. Its origins are often linked to the influences of Central Asian cuisine, particularly from the region of Kabul, hence the name.
description: Kabuli is a flavorful rice dish cooked with an assortment of spices, dried fruits, nuts, and often chickpeas. It's known for its unique blend of sweet and savory flavors.

instructions.title: Prepare the Rice
instructions.description: Wash the Basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: In a cooking pot, boil water with a bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves. Add the rice and cook until it's 70% done. Drain and set aside.

instructions.title: Sauté the Ingredients
instructions.description: In a frying pan, heat ghee or oil. Add cumin seeds, onions, and sauté until golden. Add the chickpeas, dried fruits, nuts, and sauté for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Assemble and Cook
instructions.description: Layer the sautéed mixture with the partially cooked rice in the cooking pot. Sprinkle soaked saffron strands over it. Cover and cook on a low flame until the rice is fully done.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fluff the rice gently and serve hot. Garnish with additional nuts or dried fruits if desired.

tips: Soaking the rice beforehand helps it cook faster and evenly.
Ensure not to overcook the rice in the first step to avoid it becoming mushy.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or carrots for a more nutritious dish.
Substitute chickpeas with paneer or tofu for a protein-rich version.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave, adding a little water if needed.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative serving dish, garnished with nuts and dried fruits.
Pair with raita or a simple salad for a complete meal.
